  • Method Details

    • register

      public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> register​(Player player)
      This method handles the given player information to be saved to database. If password or username is not empty and also username is not token already, it insert a new player to the player table. Otherwise, it returns error messages.
      Specified by:
      register in interface PlayerService
      Parameters:
      player - information contains username,e-mail and password
      Returns:
      Response message

    • forgetPassword

      public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> forgetPassword​(String emailJson) throws org.springframework.boot.configurationprocessor.json.JSONException
      This method checks whether an actual player exists with given e-mail or not. If player exists, it resets the password of the player with randomly generated password Send new password as an e-mail to given e-mail address If player is not exists, it returns error message
      Specified by:
      forgetPassword in interface PlayerService
      Parameters:
      emailJson - that is e-mail of the player
      Returns:
      Response message
      Throws:
      org.springframework.boot.configurationprocessor.json.JSONException - when an exception caught

    • sendEmail

      private void sendEmail​(String code, Player player)
      This methods establishes configurations for sending an email to player
      Parameters:
      code - unique verification code
      player - who forgot their passwords
